item.title: Contract positions are the perfect solution for companies in Singapore
item.description:
A recent survey by Robert Walters, a global recruitment firm, indicates a rise in contract employment in Singapore. The Singapore Contracting Survey reveals that hiring managers are increasingly turning to skilled contract workers due to difficulties in obtaining approval for permanent positions. Many companies are implementing hiring freezes, often mandated by their headquarters, leading managers in Singapore to seek adaptable, temporary staffing solutions. The survey, which polled over 300 professionals in Singapore with contracting experience, explored the advantages and disadvantages of contract work...

item.title: Tech Jobs Come Calling
item.description:
Although the Great Recession continues, the impact varies across industries. In fact, the technology sector is performing quite well in terms of employment. From November to December of last year, while 85,000 jobs were lost overall, the tech industry actually added 5,200 new positions. This suggests that technology might be a promising field. However, having technological skills doesn’t guarantee employment. Many factory workers, for instance, would likely agree. item.description:
